required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pregabalin In Partial Seizures (PREPS): An Open-Label, Multicenter Add On Therapy Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Pregabalin In Partial Seizures (PREPS): An Open-Label, Multicenter Add On Therapy Trial. A Phase IV Open-Label Trial Using 150,300, 600 mg/Day Of Pregabalin

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the clinical improvement by partial seizures reduction, safety and tolerability of subjects having partial epilepsy related to the adjunction of pregabalin BID (75 to 300mg day titration, BID) to existing standard AED (Antiepileptic drugs).

detailed_description.textblock: This study was terminated on 17 March 2009 due to delayed enrollment. The decision to terminate the trial was not based on any safety concerns, but rather on timelines and the difficulty in enrolling patients in this open label, single group study.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in 28 Day Partial Seizure Rate During Treatment Observation Phase
primary_outcome.time_frame: Week 9 to Week 21 or End of Treatment (early termination)
primary_outcome.description: 28-day seizure rate (at observation period [obs]) = [(number of seizures obs ) divided by (duration of period based on observed last dosing date and Visit 3 [Week 9] date)] * 28. Percent change = [(28-day seizure rate obs minus 28-day seizure rate at baseline [b]) divided by 28-day seizure rate b] * 100. Negative values indicate a decrease in seizure frequency and positive values reflect an increase in seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 9 to Week 21 or End of Treatment (early termination)
secondary_outcome.description: Response ratio (RR) = comparison between baseline 28-seizure frequency with the 12 week observation phase. RR = [(28-day seizure rate in observation period [obs] minus 28-day seizure rate at baseline [b] ) divided by (28-day seizure rate obs plus 28-day seizure rate b)] * 100. Range: -100 to 100; negative values for the RR indicate reductions in seizures.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in 28-Day Partial Seizure Frequency at Week 21
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 21 or End of Treatment (early termination)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent change from Baseline = [(28-day seizure rate at 21 weeks minus 28-day seizure rate at baseline [b]) divided by (28-day seizure rate b) * 100. Negative values indicate a decrease in seizure frequency, positive values reflect an increase in seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Seizure Frequency in Participants Who Had <=6 Seizures and >6 Seizures During the Baseline Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 9 to Week 21 or End of Treatment (early termination)
secondary_outcome.description: Negative values indicate a decrease in seizure frequency; positive values reflect an increase in seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Seizure- Free Participants During the Treatment Observation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 9 to Week 21 or Early Termination (end of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure-free = no seizures during observation period (100 percent reduction in seizures from baseline).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Seizure Free Participants During the Last 4 Weeks of the Treatment Observation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 17 to Week 21 (or Last 4 Weeks of Treatment after Week 9)
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure-free = no seizures during last 4 weeks of observation period (100 percent reduction in seizures from baseline).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants With >=50% Reduction in Seizure Frequency (28-day Seizure Rate) Between Baseline and Final 4 Weeks of the Treatment Observation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 17 to Week 21 (or Last 4 Weeks of Treatment after Week 9)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants With >=75% Reduction in Seizure Frequency (28-day Seizure Rate) Between Baseline and Final 4 Weeks of the Treatment Observation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 17 through Week 21 (or Last 4 Weeks of Treatment after Week 9)

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Satisfaction: Patient General Impression to Change (PGIC)
secondary_outcome.description: Patient General Impression to Change (PGIC): participant rated instrument to measure participant's change in overall status since beginning study medication on a 7-point scale; range: 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Not done = participant did not complete the PGIC.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Sleep Interference: Medical Outcome Sleep Scale (MOS)
secondary_outcome.description: Participant rated questionnaire to assess sleep quality and quantity; 9-item overall sleep problems index and 7 subscales. Sleep disturbance, snoring, awaken short of breath, somnolence, and adequacy subscale scores (s) rated 1 (all the time) to 6 (none of the time); transformed s; total range (r): 0 to 100; higher s = greater intensity of attribute; negative values (v) = reduction from baseline (b), positive v = increase from b. Sleep Quantity score r: 0-24 hours. Higher s = greater quantity of sleep. Change = (MOS score at observation period minus MOS score at b) divided by MOS score b.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Sleep Interference: Medical Outcome Sleep Scale (MOS): Optimal Sleep Subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Optimal Sleep subscale of the MOS subject rated questionnaire to assess sleep quality and quantity. Optimal Sleep (1 of 7 subscales) was derived from sleep quantity: average hours of sleep each night during the past week. Number of subjects with response: YES=1 (optimal sleep: quantity of sleep was 7 or 8 hours per night) or No= 0 (no optimal sleep). Negative value indicates a decrease in attribute; positive value indicates an increase in attribute. Change = (MOS score at observation period minus MOS score at baseline [b]) divided by MOS score b.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS)
secondary_outcome.description: Participant rated questionnaire with 2 subscales: HADS-A assesses generalized anxiety (anxious mood, restlessness, anxious thoughts, panic attacks); HADS-D: state of lost interest and diminished pleasure response (lowering of hedonic tone). Each subscale has 7 items; range: 0 (no anxiety or depression) to 3 (severe anxiety or depression). Total score 0 to 21 for each subscale; higher score = greater severity of symptoms. Negative value = reduction from baseline (b), positive value = increase from b. Change = (HADS score at observation period minus HADS score at b) divided by HADS score b.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or Female who are diagnosed of partial seizure (simple partial, complex partial, partial seizure secondarily generalized) as defined in the international league of epilepsy classification of seizure.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients having a treatable cause of seizure, currently receiving vigabatrin, having a progressive neurological or systemic disorder.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 152 subjects were screened and 136 subjects were assigned to study treatment.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: 150 mg per day as two doses (75 mg twice daily; BID), increased to 600 mg per day (300 mg BID) as needed based on response and tolerability

participants_list.participants: At least 1 dose of study medication and had a baseline and at least 1 post-baseline measurement.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: 150 mg per day as two doses (75 mg twice daily; BID), increased to 600 mg per day (300 mg BID) as needed based on response and tolerability

measure.title: 28-Day Seizure Rate
measure.description: Number of partial seizures in baseline period divided by duration of period based on observed visit dates multiplied by 28.

measure.title: 28 day seizure frequency in Subjects with <= 6 and > 6 seizures during Baseline Period
measure.description: Baseline period = 8 week period before Visit 1 date, including any unplanned readings falling under this period.

measure.title: Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Scale
measure.description: Subject rated questionnaire to assess sleep quality and quantity. For 5 of 7 subscales transformed total score range = 0 to 100; other subscales: Sleep Quantity range: 0-24 hours; and Optimal Sleep range: 1 (optimal sleep: quantity 7 or 8 hours per night), or 0 (no optimal sleep). Higher score indicates greater intensity or quantity of attribute.

measure.title: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS)
measure.description: HADS-A: generalized anxiety; HADS-D: lost interest and diminished pleasure response (lowering of hedonic tone). Total score 0 to 21 for each subscale; higher score indicates greater severity of anxiety and depression symptoms.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in 28 Day Partial Seizure Rate During Treatment Observation Phase
outcome.description: 28-day seizure rate (at observation period [obs]) = [(number of seizures obs ) divided by (duration of period based on observed last dosing date and Visit 3 [Week 9] date)] * 28. Percent change = [(28-day seizure rate obs minus 28-day seizure rate at baseline [b]) divided by 28-day seizure rate b] * 100. Negative values indicate a decrease in seizure frequency and positive values reflect an increase in seizure frequency.
outcome.time_frame: Week 9 to Week 21 or End of Treatment (early termination)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all subjects who received at least 1 dose of assigned treatment, had valid baseline seizure data, and had at least 1 subsequent rating of seizure frequency (modified intent to treat population). N=number of subjects with evaluable data.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: 75 mg BID (twice daily); may have been increased to 150 mg BID after Week 1, and to 300 mg BID after Week 2 based on response and tolerability

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in 28 Day Partial Seizure Rate During Treatment Observation Phase
measure.description: 28-day seizure rate (at observation period [obs]) = [(number of seizures obs ) divided by (duration of period based on observed last dosing date and Visit 3 [Week 9] date)] * 28. Percent change = [(28-day seizure rate obs minus 28-day seizure rate at baseline [b]) divided by 28-day seizure rate b] * 100. Negative values indicate a decrease in seizure frequency and positive values reflect an increase in seizure frequency.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all subjects who received at least 1 dose of assigned treatment, had valid baseline seizure data, and had at least 1 subsequent rating of seizure frequency (modified intent to treat population). N=number of subjects with evaluable data.

analysis.groups_desc: Percent change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.

outcome.title: Response Ratio (RR)

RR = [(28-day seizure rate in observation period [obs] minus 28-day seizure rate at baseline [b] ) divided by (28-day seizure rate obs plus 28-day seizure rate b)] * 100. Range: -100 to 100; negative values for the RR indicate reductions in seizures.

outcome.population: FAS. N=number of subjects with evaluable data.

analysis.groups_desc: Week 21: Sleep Disturbance. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
LOCF: Sleep Disturbance. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
Week 21: Snoring. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
LOCF: Snoring. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
Week 21: Awaken Short of Breath. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
LOCF: Awaken Short of Breath. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
Week 21: Sleep Adequacy. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
LOCF: Sleep Adequacy. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
Week 21: Somnolence. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
LOCF: Somnolence. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
Week 21: 9-Item Overall Sleep Problems Index. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
LOCF: 9-Item Overall Sleep Problem Index. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
Week 21: Quantity of Sleep. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
LOCF: Quantity of Sleep. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.

outcome.description: Optimal Sleep subscale of the MOS subject rated questionnaire to assess sleep quality and quantity. Optimal Sleep (1 of 7 subscales) was derived from sleep quantity: average hours of sleep each night during the past week. Number of subjects with response: YES=1 (optimal sleep: quantity of sleep was 7 or 8 hours per night) or No= 0 (no optimal sleep). Negative value indicates a decrease in attribute; positive value indicates an increase in attribute. Change = (MOS score at observation period minus MOS score at baseline [b]) divided by MOS score b.

analysis.groups_desc: Week 21; change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
LOCF; change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS)
outcome.description: Participant rated questionnaire with 2 subscales: HADS-A assesses generalized anxiety (anxious mood, restlessness, anxious thoughts, panic attacks); HADS-D: state of lost interest and diminished pleasure response (lowering of hedonic tone). Each subscale has 7 items; range: 0 (no anxiety or depression) to 3 (severe anxiety or depression). Total score 0 to 21 for each subscale; higher score = greater severity of symptoms. Negative value = reduction from baseline (b), positive value = increase from b. Change = (HADS score at observation period minus HADS score at b) divided by HADS score b.
outcome.population: FAS. LOCF = Last Observation Carried Forward.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: 75 mg BID (twice daily); may have been increased to 150 mg BID after Week 1, and to 300 mg BID after Week 2 based on response and tolerability

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS)
measure.description: Participant rated questionnaire with 2 subscales: HADS-A assesses generalized anxiety (anxious mood, restlessness, anxious thoughts, panic attacks); HADS-D: state of lost interest and diminished pleasure response (lowering of hedonic tone). Each subscale has 7 items; range: 0 (no anxiety or depression) to 3 (severe anxiety or depression). Total score 0 to 21 for each subscale; higher score = greater severity of symptoms. Negative value = reduction from baseline (b), positive value = increase from b. Change = (HADS score at observation period minus HADS score at b) divided by HADS score b.
measure.population: FAS. LOCF = Last Observation Carried Forward.

analysis.groups_desc: Anxiety: Week 21. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
Anxiety: LOCF. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
Depression: Week 21. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.
Depression: LOCF. Change from baseline evaluated by a one-sample two-sided t-test comparing the difference to zero.

reported_events.desc: Safety population = all subjects who took at least 1 dose of study medication. An Adverse Event (AE) term may be reported as both a serious and non-serious AE, but are distinct events. AE may = serious for 1 subject and = non-serious for another subject or subject may have experienced both a serious and non-serious episode of the same event.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: 75 mg BID (twice daily); may have been increased to 150 mg BID after Week 1, and to 300 mg BID after Week 2 based on response and tolerability

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
